name: AdvPhishing
description: AdvPhishing is an advanced phishing tool used for creating fake login pages to steal credentials. This tool generates realistic-looking login pages for various popular websites, such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Gmail, and captures the credentials entered by victims.

name: Aircrack-ng
description: Aircrack-ng is a comprehensive suite of tools designed to assess Wi-Fi network security. It focuses on various aspects of Wi-Fi security, including monitoring (packet capture), attacking (replay attacks, deauthentication, fake access points, and other techniques using packet injection), testing (evaluating Wi-Fi card and driver capabilities for packet capture and injection), and cracking (breaking WEP and WPA-PSK encryption for WPA1 and WPA2). Key Components of Aircrack-ng Suite: Airbase-ng, Aircrack-ng, Airdecap-ng, Airdrop-ng, Aireplay-ng, Airgraph-ng, Airmon-ng, Airodump-ng, Airolib-ng, Airtun-ng.

name: Airgeddon
description: Airgeddon is a powerful, multi-functional Wi-Fi auditing tool designed for penetration testing and security assessments of wireless networks. It provides an automated framework to perform various attacks, including wireless network scanning, Evil Twin attacks (rogue AP), WPA/WPA2 handshake capture and cracking, WPS attacks using Reaver, Bully, and Pixie-Dust, Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks, and Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attacks. Additionally, it features an automated mode for easy execution, making it accessible for both beginners and advanced users in Wi-Fi security testing.

name: Amass
description: The OWASP Amass Project performs network mapping of attack surfaces and external asset discovery using open-source information gathering and active reconnaissance techniques. It enables subdomain and DNS enumeration, graph-based visualization, integration with external sources, ASN and IP address mapping, scraping, and web archive analysis. These capabilities help identify subdomains, map external assets, and uncover vulnerabilities in an organization's infrastructure.

name: AndroRAT
description: AndroRAT is an open-source remote access tool for Android devices, designed to remotely control an Android system and extract information from it. It operates as a client-server application. AndroRAT provides a fully persistent backdoor with an invisible icon upon installation and automatically starts on boot. It enables remote access via a command-and-control (C2) server, allowing data extraction such as contacts, call logs, messages, device location, and SIM card details. Additionally, it can manipulate SMS and calls, perform keylogging, track GPS location, and manage applications by installing or uninstalling them remotely. The tool also grants unauthorized access to the microphone and camera for recording audio, capturing photos, and recording videos, along with retrieving network details like IP and MAC addresses.

name: Angry IP Scanner
description: Angry IP Scanner (or simply ipscan) is an open-source, cross-platform network scanner that scans IP addresses, IP ranges, and ports. It is used for discovering devices on a network and gathering host information.

name: Apktool
description: Apktool is a tool for reverse engineering third-party, closed, binary Android apps. It can decode resources to nearly their original form and rebuild them after modifications, enabling step-by-step debugging of smali code. It simplifies working with apps through a project-like file structure and automates repetitive tasks such as building APKs. It can disassemble, assemble, and analyze Android applications.

name: Bettercap
description: The Swiss Army knife for WiFi, Bluetooth Low Energy, wireless HID hijacking, CAN-bus and IPv4 and IPv6 networks reconnaissance and MITM attacks. WiFi scanning, deauthentication and PMKID attacks, and automatic WPA/WPA2 handshake capture; Bluetooth Low Energy scanning, characteristics enumeration, and data read/write; 2.4GHz device scanning and MouseJacking attacks with HID frame injection (DuckyScript support); passive and active IP probing; ARP, DNS, DHCPv6, and NDP spoofing for MITM on IPv4/IPv6; scriptable proxies at packet, TCP, and HTTP/HTTPS levels; a network sniffer for credential harvesting and protocol fuzzing; a fast port scanner; and CAN-bus support for reading, injecting, fuzzing, DBC loading, and OBD2 PIDs parsing.

name: BillCipher
description: Information gathering tool for websites and IP addresses. It retrieves data such as DNS records, WHOIS details, GeoIP, subnet information, port scanning results, page links, zone transfers, HTTP headers, host discovery, IP location, shared DNS records, robots.txt, reverse IP lookup, email discovery, subdomains, admin login detection, Cloudflare bypass techniques, website copying, and host details.

name: Burp Suite
description: Burp Suite is a Java-based web application vulnerability scanner and penetration testing framework, allowing for the interception and manipulation of HTTP/HTTPS traffic between a browser and server.

name: CamOver
description: CamOver is a camera exploitation tool designed to disclose network camera admin passwords. It exploits vulnerabilities in popular camera models such as CCTV, GoAhead, and Netwave. The tool is optimized for efficiency, allowing users to target multiple cameras simultaneously using threading.

name: CamPhish
description: CamPhish is a technique used to capture cam shots from a target's phone front camera or PC webcam. It hosts a fake website on an in-built PHP server and utilizes Ngrok and Cloudflare Tunnel to generate a shareable link, allowing access over the internet. When the target opens the link, the website requests camera permissions, and if granted, the tool captures cam shots from the target's device. Additionally, it can obtain GPS location data, all by simply sending a link.

name: Censys
description: Censys is a cybersecurity tool and search engine that scans the internet to collect and analyze publicly available data about hosts, networks, and devices. It provides insights into open ports, services, SSL/TLS certificates, web servers, IoT devices, cloud services, domains, subdomains, hosts, infrastructure, and the technologies used by a website.

name: CeWL
description: CeWL (Custom Word List generator) is a tool used for creating wordlists by crawling a specified URL and extracting words from it. It is used to create custom wordlists for password cracking or dictionary attacks. It can scan web pages recursively to gather more words and extract metadata from documents like PDFs and Office files.

name: CmosPwd
description: CmosPwd is an open-source tool used to decrypt, recover, or reset BIOS/CMOS passwords and reset BIOS settings on various computer systems. It can also back up, restore, and erase/kill CMOS.

name: Cycript
description: Cycript allows developers to explore and modify running applications on iOS or macOS using a hybrid of Objective-C++ and JavaScript syntax through an interactive console featuring syntax highlighting and tab completion. (It also runs standalone on Android and Linux, providing access to Java but without injection.)

name: Damn Small SQLi Scanner
description: Damn Small SQLi Scanner (DSSS) is a fully functional SQL injection vulnerability scanner (supporting GET and POST parameters).

name: Dig
description: Domain Information Groper is a network administration tool used for querying the Domain Name System (DNS).

name: DIRB
description: DIRB (Directory Buster) is a web content scanner used for brute-forcing directories and files on web servers. It searches for existing and hidden web objects by launching a dictionary-based attack against a web server and analyzing the responses. It helps discover hidden web directories and files that are not normally visible or indexed.

name: DNSDumpster.com
description: A free online DNS reconnaissance and research tool that helps gather information about a domain’s infrastructure. It is used for network reconnaissance, including subdomain enumeration, DNS records lookup, IP and host mapping, reverse DNS lookup, geolocation, and WHOIS data.

name: DNSRecon
description: DNSRecon is a powerful DNS enumeration tool, supporting zone transfer checks, general record enumeration (MX, SOA, NS, A, AAAA, SPF, TXT), SRV record discovery, TLD expansion, and wildcard resolution detection. It can brute-force subdomains, perform PTR lookups for IP ranges, and check DNS server caches for A, AAAA, and CNAME records.

name: Domain Dossier
description: Domain Dossier is an online tool for gathering domain and IP intelligence. It provides WHOIS data, DNS records, IP details, traceroute analysis, and blacklist checks.

name: Drozer
description: Drozer is an open-source security assessment framework for the Android platform. It helps identify vulnerabilities in apps and devices by interacting with the Android Runtime, other apps' IPC endpoints, and the underlying operating system. Drozer also provides tools to analyze and utilize public Android exploits. It can perform actions similar to an installed application, such as leveraging Android’s Inter-Process Communication (IPC) mechanism. Its key features include Application Attack Surface Analysis, Privilege Escalation, Exploit Misconfigurations, Reverse Engineering, and Remote Exploitation.

name: E-TOOL
description: E-TOOL is a tool that can capture microphone voice notes and retrieve photos from a victim's phone. It works on both rooted and non-rooted Android devices.

name: Enum4linux
description: Enum4linux is a Linux-based tool used for enumerating information from Windows systems, particularly those running SMB services. It provides various enumeration capabilities, including user enumeration, share enumeration, group enumeration, OS detection, password policy retrieval, RID cycling, and SAM dumping.

name: EAPHammer
description: EAPHammer is a toolkit for performing targeted evil twin attacks against WPA2-Enterprise networks. Indirect wireless pivots using hostile portal attacks. It automates evil twin and credential harvesting attacks against 802.1X networks, including Evil Twin attacks on WPA2-EAP (Enterprise), MSCHAPv2 credential theft, automated Hostapd setup, captive portal attacks, support for both 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequencies, and Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) capabilities.

name: Ettercap
description: Ettercap is a comprehensive suite for man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks. It features live connection sniffing, real-time content filtering, and various advanced network manipulation techniques. It supports both active and passive protocol dissection and offers numerous tools for network and host analysis. Commonly used for network security testing and penetration testing to identify vulnerabilities in both wired and wireless networks. Key features include MITM attacks, packet sniffing, active and passive network scanning, SSL/TLS stripping, ARP spoofing, DNS spoofing, and plugin support.

name: ExifTool
description: ExifTool is a powerful command-line tool and library used for reading, writing, and editing metadata in files, especially images, videos, and documents.

name: Exploit DB
description: The Exploit Database is a CVE compliant archive of public exploits and corresponding vulnerable software, developed for use by penetration testers and vulnerability researchers. The Exploit Database is a repository for exploits and proof-of-concepts rather than advisories, making it a valuable resource for those who need actionable data right away.

name: Fern Wifi Cracker
description: Fern WiFi Cracker is a GUI-based wireless security auditing tool for WiFi vulnerability assessments. It automates WiFi attacks on WEP, WPA, and WPA2 networks and includes features like WEP and WPA/WPA2 cracking, deauthentication attacks, session hijacking, MITM attacks, supports external tools such as Aircrack-ng, Reaver, xHydra, and more.

name: Fierce
description: A DNS reconnaissance tool for locating non-contiguous IP space.

name: Fing - Network Tools
description: Fing - Network Tools is a powerful network scanning and troubleshooting app that helps users analyze and secure their home or office network. It features a network scanner, device recognition (fingerprinting), port scanner, Wi-Fi security analysis, internet speed test, and network troubleshooting tools.

name: FOCA
description: FOCA (Fingerprinting Organizations with Collected Archives) is a tool primarily used to extract metadata and hidden information from scanned documents. It can analyze documents found on web pages by downloading and processing them.

name: Frida
description: Frida is a powerful dynamic instrumentation toolkit used for reverse engineering, security research, and application debugging. It allows developers and researchers to inject JavaScript or Python code into running applications on platforms like Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, and Android. Frida is commonly used for mobile app testing, bypassing root or jailbreak detection, reverse engineering, and cybersecurity research.

name: Ghost
description: Ghost Framework is an Android post-exploitation framework that exploits the Android Debug Bridge (ADB) to remotely access and control Android devices. Its key features include remote access, device control, ADB exploitation, file management, and system control.

name: Gobuster
description: Gobuster is a tool used to brute-force: URIs (directories and files) in web sites, DNS subdomains (with wildcard support), Virtual Host names on target web servers, Open Amazon S3 buckets, Open Google Cloud buckets, TFTP servers.

name: Google Hacking Database
description: The Google Hacking Database (GHDB) is a categorized index of Internet search engine queries designed to uncover interesting, and usually sensitive, information made publicly available on the Internet.

name: HACK-CAMERA
description: Hack a victim's Android camera using a link with Termux or Kali Linux. Capture IP address, location, device type, and browser information. Supports dual tunneling using Cloudflare and Ngrok for secure access.

name: Hashcat
description: Hashcat is the world's fastest and most advanced password recovery utility, supporting five unique attack modes and over 300 highly optimized hashing algorithms. It runs on CPUs, GPUs, and other hardware accelerators across Linux, Windows, and macOS and includes features for distributed password cracking. Hashcat uses brute force, dictionary attacks, rule-based attacks, and GPU acceleration to crack hashes efficiently. It supports a wide range of hashing algorithms, including MD5, SHA-256, NTLM, WPA/WPA2, bcrypt, and more.

name: Hcxtools
description: Hcxtools is a small set of tools designed to convert packets from capture files into hash files for use with Hashcat or John the Ripper. It is a collection of WiFi penetration testing tools that capture and analyze WPA/WPA2/WPA3 authentication handshakes for offline password cracking. Widely used in network security assessments, it supports multiple attack vectors, including PMKID attacks, hash extraction, and raw frame capturing. Key features include WPA/WPA2/WPA3 handshake capture, PMKID attack support, deauthentication and disassociation attacks, AP-less attacks, conversion tools, and support for IoT & industrial WiFi networks.

name: Hoaxshell
description: A Windows reverse shell payload generator and handler that abuses the http(s) protocol to establish a beacon-like reverse shell.

name: Host
description: The host command is a simple DNS lookup utility used to find IP addresses, domain names, mail servers, and other DNS-related information.

name: Hostapd-Mana
description: Hostapd-Mana is a feature-rich rogue Wi-Fi access point tool. It can be used for various purposes, including tracking and deanonymizing devices (Snoopy), gathering corporate credentials from devices attempting EAP authentication (WPE), or attracting multiple devices to connect for MITM attacks. It enhances rogue access point (AP) attacks by bypassing common security mechanisms and capturing credentials from clients. Key features include Rogue Access Point (Evil Twin AP), EAP credential harvesting, Karma attack, SSID mimicry, SSL strip support, captive portal attacks, and integration with tools such as Bettercap, Aircrack-ng, and Responder.

name: Hping3
description: Hping3 is a command-line network security tool used for packet crafting, scanning, and network testing. It is similar to ping but offers more advanced features, allowing users to send custom TCP, UDP, ICMP, and raw IP packets.

name: httprint
description: httprint is a web server fingerprinting tool that helps identify web server software and versions based on their HTTP responses.

name: HTTrack Website Copier
description: HTTrack is an offline browser utility that allows you to download an entire website from the Internet to a local directory. It recursively builds all directories and retrieves HTML, images, and other files from the server to your computer. HTTrack preserves the original site's relative link structure.

name: Hybrid Analysis
description: This is a free malware analysis service for the community that detects and analyzes unknown threats using a unique Hybrid Analysis technology. It is an online service that provides deep insights into potentially malicious files and URLs.

name: Hydra
description: THC-Hydra is a parallelized login cracker capable of performing rapid brute-force and dictionary attacks against various services. It is commonly used in penetration testing environments like Kali Linux and Parrot OS. The tool supports numerous protocols.

name: Impacket
description: Impacket is a collection of Python classes for working with network protocols.

name: inSSIDer
description: inSSIDer is a Wi-Fi network analysis tool developed by MetaGeek. It helps users analyze and optimize their Wi-Fi networks by providing insights into signal strength, interference, and channel usage.

name: Internet Archive
description: Internet Archive is a non-profit library of millions of free texts, movies, software, music, websites, and more.

name: John the Ripper
description: John the Ripper Jumbo is an advanced offline password cracker that supports hundreds of hash and cipher types. Its primary purpose is to identify weak Unix passwords. It is an open-source tool for password security auditing and recovery.

name: Knock
description: Knockpy is a portable and modular python3 tool designed to quickly enumerate subdomains on a target domain through passive reconnaissance and dictionary scan.

name: L0phtCrack
description: L0phtCrack is a password auditing and recovery tool used to assess the strength of passwords by cracking Windows account passwords using various attack techniques. It features Password Hash Extraction, Multiple Cracking Techniques, and Automated Auditing, making it a powerful tool for security testing and compliance checks.

name: Linux Router
description: Set up Linux as a router with a single command, supporting internet sharing, a transparent proxy (redsocks), WiFi hotspot, and IPv6. It can also be used for routing VMs and containers. Key features include creating a NATed sub-network, providing internet access, running a DHCP server (with RA), acting as a DNS server, supporting IPv6 behind a NATed LAN (similar to IPv4), creating a WiFi hotspot or access point, enabling a transparent proxy (redsocks), and hijacking port 53 packets for transparent DNS proxying.

name: Linux Wifi Hotspot
description: Feature-rich wifi hotspot creator for Linux which provides both GUI and command-line interface. It is also able to create a hotspot using the same wifi card which is connected to an AP already ( Similar to Windows 10). The tool supports 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequencies, works with WPA3 encryption, and includes a bridged mode for sharing an existing connection. It also offers MAC filtering support and an easy setup with a single script.

name: LOIC
description: Low Orbit Ion Cannon (LOIC) is an open source network stress tool, written in C#. LOIC is based on Praetox's LOIC project.

name: Maltego
description: Maltego is a graph-based intelligence and forensics tool used for OSINT gathering, link analysis, and data visualization. It discovers relationships between entities such as domains, IP addresses, emails, social media accounts, infrastructure, and threat actors.

name: MDK4
description: MDK4 is a network penetration testing tool used for Wi-Fi security assessments. MDK4 is a new version of MDK3. It is specifically designed to test wireless networks by exploiting vulnerabilities in various Wi-Fi protocols, including WEP, WPA, WPA2, and WPA3. MDK4 can be used for multiple Wi-Fi attack scenarios, such as deauthentication attacks, authentication flooding, beacon flooding, probe request/response attacks, EAPOL attacks, TKIP MIC attacks, and Wi-Fi channel hopping attacks.

name: Metagoofil
description: Metagoofil is an open-source tool that gathers metadata from publicly available documents on the internet. It extracts information such as usernames, software versions, and emails from PDFs, DOCs, XLSs, and PPTs. It searches Google for specific file types and can optionally download them.

name: Metasploit
description: An open-source project that provides the infrastructure, content, and tools for performing penetration tests and extensive security audits. It is a framework used for exploiting, testing, and securing systems, offering a collection of exploits, payloads, scanners, and post-exploitation tools.

name: Mimikatz
description: Extract plaintext passwords, hashes, PINs, and Kerberos tickets from memory, as well as perform pass-the-hash, pass-the-ticket, and create Golden Tickets.

name: MobSF
description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is an automated, all-in-one platform for mobile application (Android, iOS, Windows) security assessment, penetration testing, malware analysis, and privacy analysis. It supports both static and dynamic analysis, processing popular app binaries like APK, IPA, and APPX, as well as source code. The Dynamic Analyzer enables interactive instrumented testing, runtime data monitoring, and network traffic analysis for Android and iOS applications. MobSF also integrates seamlessly with DevSecOps and CI/CD pipelines via REST APIs and CLI tools, enhancing security workflows efficiently.

name: Mole
description: Mole is an automatic SQL Injection exploitation tool. Only by providing a vulnerable URL and a valid string on the site it can detect the injection and exploit it, either by using the union technique or a boolean query based technique.

name: Mrphish
description: MrPhish is a Bash-based script officially designed for phishing social media accounts with port forwarding and OTP bypass control. This tool works on both rooted and non-rooted Android devices.

name: MW Youtube Metadata
description: MW Metadata normal grabs singular details about a YouTube video and its uploader, playlist and its creator, or channel.

name: MXToolBox
description: MXToolbox is a free online toolset for email, DNS, and network diagnostics. It is widely used by IT professionals, system administrators, and security experts to monitor and troubleshoot email servers, DNS records, and blacklists.

name: NAPALM FTP Indexer
description: NAPALM FTP Indexer is an advanced FTP search engine that allows users to search and download files from public FTP servers. It maintains a comprehensive database of files from numerous FTP servers, updated regularly by an intelligent FTP crawler.

name: NBTscan
description: NBTscan is a program for scanning IP networks for NetBIOS name information. For each responding host it lists IP address, NetBIOS computer name, logged-in user name and MAC address (such as Ethernet).

name: Ncrack
description: Ncrack is a high-speed network authentication cracking tool. It was built to help companies secure their networks by proactively testing all their hosts and networking devices for poor passwords. Security professionals also rely on Ncrack when auditing their clients.

name: Nessus
description: Nessus is a widely used vulnerability scanner developed by Tenable. It helps identify potential vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and security issues in your systems, network devices, and web applications. It scans for a variety of known security flaws, including those related to software versions, missing patches, and weak configurations, to help organizations improve their security posture.

name: Netcat
description: The Swiss Army Knife of Networking - Netcat (nc) is a simple Unix utility which reads and writes data across network connections, using TCP or UDP protocol. it can create almost any kind of connection you would need and has several interesting built-in capabilities.

name: Netcraft Research Tools
description: Tools to discover the infrastructure and technologies a site is using, identify the most popular websites, and enhance internet safety.

name: Nikto
description: Nikto is an Open Source web server scanner which performs comprehensive tests against web servers for multiple items, including over 7,000 potentially dangerous files/programs, checks for outdated versions of over 1250 servers, and version specific problems on over 270 servers. It also checks for server configuration items such as the presence of multiple index files, HTTP server options, and will attempt to identify installed web servers and software.

name: njRAT
description: NjRAT-0.7D is a powerful remote administration tool (RAT) for Windows systems, enabling remote access and control of infected machines. It is capable of keylogging, webcam access, credential theft, file manipulation, desktop viewing, and botnet control.

name: Nmap
description: Network Mapper scans networks to identify devices, open ports, services, and detect OS and service versions. It also performs vulnerability scanning and automates network scanning tasks.

name: NoSQLMap
description: NoSQLMap is an open source Python tool designed to audit for as well as automate injection attacks and exploit default configuration weaknesses in NoSQL databases and web applications using NoSQL in order to disclose or clone data from the database.

name: Nslookup
description: The nslookup (Name Server Lookup) command is a DNS query tool used to find IP addresses, domain names, mail servers, and other DNS records.

name: OpenVAS
description: OpenVAS is a full-featured vulnerability scanner. Its capabilities include unauthenticated and authenticated testing, various high-level and low-level internet and industrial protocols, performance tuning for large-scale scans and a powerful internal programming language to implement any type of vulnerability test.

name: OSINT.SH
description: All in one Information Gathering Tools - Public Buckets Search, Subdomain Finder, DNS History, Reverse IP Lookup, Technology Lookup, Certificate Search, DNS Lookup, Reverse Google Analytics/AdSense, Whois History, Reverse Whois, OCR Text Extractor, and MD5 Hash Guessing.

name: Pdfinfo
description: Pdfinfo is a command-line tool used to extract metadata and document properties from PDF files. It is part of the Poppler-utils package.

name: PEASS-NG
description: Privilege Escalation Awesome Scripts - Next Generation is a post-exploitation toolkit for Windows and Linux, automating privilege escalation discovery by identifying misconfigurations, vulnerable services, and weak permissions.

name: Pentest Tools
description: Pentest-Tools.com develops offensive cybersecurity tools and proprietary vulnerability scanning software for penetration testers and other infosec professionals.

name: PhoneSploit Pro
description: An all-in-one hacking tool designed to remotely exploit Android devices using ADB and the Metasploit Framework to establish a Meterpreter session. This tool can automatically create, install, and execute payloads on a target device using Metasploit Framework and ADB, enabling complete control of the Android device in a single click. It streamlines the process of payload creation, installation, and execution, making penetration testing and vulnerability assessments more efficient.

name: Photon
description: Photon is an OSINT tool used for web scraping and data extraction. It can retrieve archived URLs of the target website from Archive.org.

name: PhotoRec
description: PhotoRec is an open-source file recovery tool designed to retrieve lost or deleted files from hard drives, memory cards, USB drives, and other storage devices. It is commonly used in digital forensics and data recovery to extract lost evidence or accidentally deleted files. It will work even if the media's file system is severely damaged or reformatted.

name: Pwdump
description: Pwdump is a family of Windows password hash dumping tools used to extract NTLM and LANMAN password hashes from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database. These hashes can then be analyzed or cracked using password-cracking tools like John the Ripper or Hashcat.

name: Reaver
description: Reaver is a Wi-Fi hacking tool used to crack WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) PINs and recover WPA/WPA2 passwords. It performs a brute force attack against Wifi Protected Setup (WPS) registrar PINs in order to recover WPA/WPA2 passphrases.

name: Raccoon
description: Raccoon is an offensive security tool designed for reconnaissance and information gathering. It performs various tasks, including fetching DNS records, retrieving WHOIS information, obtaining TLS data, detecting WAF presence, threaded directory busting, and subdomain enumeration. Additionally, it supports subdomain enumeration, port scanning, service & banner grabbing, WHOIS & DNS lookups, web application scanning, OSINT, URL fuzzing, and directory & file detection.

name: ReconDog
description: Reconnaissance Swiss Army Knife - uses APIs to gather information about a target system, including Censys, NS Lookup, Port Scanning, CMS Detection, WHOIS Lookup, Honeypot Detection, Subdomain Discovery, Reverse IP Lookup, and Technology Fingerprinting.

name: Recon-NG
description: Recon-ng is a full-featured reconnaissance framework designed for fast and thorough open-source web-based intelligence gathering. It is used for OSINT collection, DNS enumeration, domain and host discovery, WHOIS lookups, port scanning, attack surface mapping, etc.

name: Reqable
description: Reqable is a modern cross-platform project, designed for API development, testing, and debugging. Reqable fully supports HTTP1 and HTTP2 and partially supports HTTP3(QUIC).

name: Responder
description: Responder is a LLMNR, NBT-NS and MDNS poisoner, with built-in HTTP/SMB/MSSQL/FTP/LDAP rogue authentication server supporting NTLMv1/NTLMv2/LMv2, Extended Security NTLMSSP and Basic HTTP authentication.

name: Reverse Shell generator
description: Hosted Reverse Shell generator with a ton of functionality.

name: RustScan
description: A modern port scanner designed for high-speed scanning of open ports on target machines, featuring full scripting engine support. It can automatically pipe results into Nmap or utilize custom scripts for further analysis.

name: Scanlogd
description: Scanlogd is a TCP port scan detection tool that monitors network traffic to detect and log TCP port scans. It helps identify potential reconnaissance activities by attackers who are scanning for open ports on a system.

name: SeaShell
description: SeaShell Framework is an iOS post-exploitation framework developed by EntySec that enables you to access a device remotely, control it, and extract sensitive information. The attacker generates an IPA file, and starts a TCP listener. The IPA needs to be installed through TrollStore or another app that exploits a similar CoreTrust bug and launched to execute the payload. The attacker will then receive an interactive session with the device. Its default payload is Pwny, with features including evasion, TLS encryption, and dynamic extensions.

name: SearchSploit
description: SearchSploit is a command-line utility that enables users to search through the Exploit Database (Exploit-DB) for publicly available exploits and shellcode. It's particularly useful for penetration testers and security researchers who require access to exploit information, even in environments without internet connectivity. ​

name: Sherlock
description: Hunt down social media accounts by username across social networks.

name: SHODAN
description: A search engine designed to detect internet-connected devices and networks with potential vulnerabilities.

name: Sixo Online APK Analyzer
description: Sixo Online APK Analyzer is a tool that allows you to analyze various details of Android APK files. It can decompile binary XML files and resources.

name: Social Searcher
description: Social Searcher - Free Social Media Search Engine

name: SmartScanner
description: SmartScanner is an AI-powered web vulnerability scanner designed to enhance web application security testing. It automates the detection of various vulnerabilities, including those listed in the OWASP Top 10, such as SQL Injection (SQLi) and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

name: Sn1per
description: Sn1per is an automated penetration testing tool for reconnaissance, vulnerability scanning, and web security assessment. It gathers subdomains, WHOIS data, DNS details, and other OSINT while scanning for vulnerabilities using tools like Nmap, Nikto, and OpenVAS. It detects web application threats such as SQL injection and XSS, performs brute-force attacks on SSH and FTP, and identifies open ports and running services.

name: Snort
description: Snort is an open-source Intrusion Detection System (IDS) and Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) developed by Cisco. It analyzes network traffic in real-time to detect and prevent potential cyber threats, such as malware, port scanning, and brute-force attacks. It features packet sniffing, custom rule writing, and protocol analysis, making it a powerful tool for network security monitoring.

name: SNMP-Check
description: SNMP-Check is a command-line tool used for enumerating SNMP-enabled devices, gathering valuable network information from routers, switches, servers, and other SNMP-supported devices by querying them using SNMP protocols. It can extract system information such as OS details, uptime, hostname, and contact info, as well as list network interfaces, including IP and MAC addresses. Additionally, it retrieves installed software, identifies running processes and services, maps open ports, and detects available network services. SNMP-Check also supports SNMP community strings like public and private for access, making it a powerful tool for security assessments and network auditing.

name: Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET)
description: The Social-Engineer Toolkit is an open-source penetration testing framework designed for social engineering.

name: Sparrow WiFi
description: Sparrow-wifi is an advanced graphical Wi-Fi and Bluetooth analyzer designed specifically for Linux systems. Developed as a next-generation tool for 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi spectral awareness, it offers a comprehensive GUI-based alternative to tools like inSSIDer and LinSSID.

name: SQLiFinder
description: Sqlifinder is a tool with the function of detecting GET-based sql injection vulnerabilities in web applications using waybackurls, web crawlers and sql injection payloads.

name: SQLMap
description: sqlmap is an open source penetration testing tool that automates the process of detecting and exploiting SQL injection flaws and taking over of database servers.

name: StormBreaker
description: Storm-Breaker is a social engineering tool that allows access to a target's webcam, microphone, and location using Python, JavaScript, and PHP. It can obtain device information without requiring explicit permission, access location data specifically from smartphones, and remotely control the webcam and microphone.

name: Subfinder
description: Subfinder is a subdomain discovery tool that returns valid subdomains for websites, using passive online sources.

name: Sublist3r
description: Sublist3r is a python tool designed to enumerate subdomains of websites using OSINT.

name: SX
description: SX is a command-line network scanner that performs ARP, TCP, and UDP scans to discover open ports. It utilizes an ARP cache mechanism for efficient scanning and provides JSON output for easy parsing.

name: TCPDump
description: TCP dump is packet analyser tool used to capture and analyse packets and network traffic in real-time over network.

name: Telnet
description: Telnet is a network protocol used to provide a command-line interface for remote access to another computer over a TCP/IP network. It allows users to log into a remote system and execute commands as if they were physically present at the machine.

name: TestDisk
description: TestDisk is an open-source data recovery software and digital forensics tool designed to recover lost partitions, fix boot issues, and restore deleted files.

name: theHarvester
description: OSINT gathering tool (collects names, emails, IP addresses, subdomains, and URLs using multiple public resources).

name: Trivy
description: Trivy is a comprehensive and versatile security scanner that analyzes a variety of targets—including container images, filesystems, remote Git repositories, virtual machine images, and Kubernetes environments—to identify potential security issues. It employs multiple scanners to detect OS packages and software dependencies (SBOM), known vulnerabilities (CVEs), infrastructure-as-code (IaC) misconfigurations, sensitive information and secrets, and software license details.

name: Turbolist3r
description: Turbolist3r is a fork of the sublist3r subdomain discovery tool. In addition to the original OSINT capabilties of sublist3r, turbolist3r automates some analysis of the results, with a focus on subdomain takeover.

name: Uniscan
description: Uniscan is a simple Remote File Include, Local File Include and Remote Command Execution vulnerability scanner.

name: URL Extractor
description: This tool extracts URLs, meta tags, images, and email addresses from webpages and files, listing relevant information while navigating links to gather domains.

name: WAFW00F
description: WAFW00F allows one to identify and fingerprint Web Application Firewall (WAF) products protecting a website.

name: Wapiti
description: Wapiti is an open-source web vulnerability scanner that audits web application security through black-box testing. It scans by crawling web pages and injecting payloads to detect vulnerabilities. After gathering URLs, forms, and inputs, Wapiti acts as a fuzzer, injecting payloads to test for vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection (SQLi), Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), File Inclusion, Command Execution, and SSRF.

name: Wash
description: Wash is a tool used alongside Reaver to identify WPS-enabled networks before launching an attack. It helps filter out networks that are vulnerable to WPS brute-force attacks by scanning nearby Wi-Fi networks and checking if WPS is enabled. Additionally, Wash determines whether a router is protected against Reaver attacks (e.g., if WPS Lockout is enabled) and displays essential details such as BSSID (MAC address), channel, and WPS version.

name: Wayback Machine
description: The Wayback Machine - Internet’s Time Machine (part of Internet Archive) is a web archiving tool that stores historical snapshots of websites. It allows users to view old versions of web pages, even if they have been deleted or modified.

name: WepCrackGUI
description: A GUI for Aircrack-ng that can crack WEP and WPA networks, automatically scans for available networks, and provides fake authentication and injection support. Features include cracking WEP and WPA-encrypted networks, support for multiple interfaces, network scanning, packet injection, fake authentication (Open and Shared key), MAC address changer, hidden SSID discovery, WEP dictionary attack, and a password generator for WPA networks.

name: Wifite
description: Wifite is an automated wireless auditing tool designed for penetration testers and ethical hackers, using all known methods to retrieve the password of a wireless access point. It simplifies WiFi attacks by automating WEP, WPA, and WPA2 cracking techniques with tools like Aircrack-ng, Reaver, and Bully. Wifite is particularly useful for Evil Twin, WPS, and handshake capture attacks with minimal user input. Key features include automated WiFi hacking, WPA/WPA2 handshake capture, WPS attacks, Evil Twin attack, deauthentication attack, hidden SSID discovery, WiFi signal jammer, block specific accesspoints or multiple, and support for multiple WiFi adapters.

name: Wireshark
description: Wireshark is a open-source network protocol analyzer that interactively captures and analyzes network traffic in real time.

name: WhatWeb
description: Next generation web scanner - WhatWeb is an open-source web reconnaissance tool used to fingerprint and analyze websites by detecting technologies, frameworks, CMS (like WordPress), and security vulnerabilities.

name: Whois
description: Retrieve WHOIS information or records for a domain.

name: Wi-Fi Scanner
description: Wi-Fi Scanner is a Wi-Fi network analysis tool designed to help users find and troubleshoot wireless networks. It provides detailed information about nearby Wi-Fi networks, including the network name (SSID), signal strength (RSSI) and quality, MAC address (BSSID), channel, maximum and achievable data rates, security settings, channel usage, and bandwidth.

name: WiFi Analyzer
description: WiFi Analyzer is a free, open-source Wi-Fi analysis tool available for Android devices. It helps users optimize their Wi-Fi networks by providing detailed insights into signal strength, channel usage, and interference. Key features include real-time signal strength monitoring, SSID & BSSID information, and more.

name: Wifiphisher
description: Wifiphisher is a rogue access point framework designed for red team engagements and Wi-Fi security testing. It allows penetration testers to achieve a man-in-the-middle position against wireless clients by performing targeted Wi-Fi association attacks. Wifiphisher can also be used for victim-customized web phishing attacks, capturing credentials from third-party login pages or WPA/WPA2 Pre-Shared Keys, and even infecting victim devices with malware. Key features include Evil Twin attacks, Deauthentication attacks, Captive Portal Phishing, Payload Injection, Multiple Attack Modes, and the ability to bypass password cracking.

name: WiFiman
description: WiFiman is a Wi-Fi and network analysis tool developed by Ubiquiti Inc. It helps users scan Wi-Fi networks, analyze signal strength, detect interference, and test internet speed.

name: Wfuzz
description: WFuzz is a web application security tool designed for brute-forcing web applications to discover hidden files, directories, parameters, and vulnerabilities. It's primarily used for fuzzing (i.e., testing web applications by sending various payloads).

name: WPScan
description: WPScan WordPress security scanner. Written for security professionals and blog maintainers to test the security of their WordPress websites.

name: XSSer
description: Cross-Site Scripter (aka XSSer) is an automated penetration testing tool designed to detect, exploit, and report Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in web applications. It supports automated scanning for XSS vulnerabilities, multiple types of XSS attacks, the ability to generate and obfuscate payloads, and integration with Tor for anonymous testing.

name: Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP)
description: ZAP (Zed Attack Proxy), or ZAP Proxy, is an open-source security tool used to identify vulnerabilities in web applications. It is developed and maintained by the OWASP community. ZAP is used for web application security testing, API penetration testing, and automated vulnerability scanning.
